Key Match Events: Netherlands put a valiant showing with the bat amassing a decent total of 158 for 4 with ex-Proteas player Colin Ackerman scoring 41 of just 26 balls.
South Africa succumbed to a thirteen run defeat at the hands of the Netherlands on an Adelaide surface which was slow but certainly not unplayable.
Pre-Game Insights: Perhaps the only confidence one could garner this time was it was minnows Netherlands they had to beat which looked rather possible to progress to the semi-finals of the T20 World Cup.
Post-Match Reflections: The all so familiar feeling of desolation had once again engulfed the South African faithful as a helpless Protea outfit succumbed to a thirteen run defeat.
One still can’t quite get his head around the mystery as to how do South Africa despite being so sound on paper always end up losing when they need to win the most?
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Adelaide surface continued to get slower.
